page.title: 08Still Working At Eighty-Two!
page.content: Emma Burlow's great great uncle Frank was recently presented with a silver bar and trophy at the Three Counties Show by Princess Margaret (sister of the Queen) for working {sixty years}with the House family who are local farmers. It is remarkable that this man at eighty-two years old,still works a five day week and even overtime when needed.He remembers the horses in the old days and the changing over to machinery on the farm. Frank lived in Pauntley for twenty three years but is now living in Taynton.His house used to be the old Post Office and two families shared the house.In the wartime he kept some pigs and some sheep which he sold.Now he just has a cat and a goldfish.
